page.title: 01PACKINGTON
page.content: Packington is a village of about 600 people situated about 2 miles south of Ashby de la Zouch in Leicestershire. It is an ancient village,Its water mill being mentioned in the original Domesday Book.Until recently it had a purely agricultural economy with a small hand-knitting industry.However during the Second World War there was considerable open cast mining in the area.Today, Packington is a thriving commuter village with several new housing estates.People commute to neighbouring towns and cities.The village has several amenities that will be dealt with on later pages and a sketch of the agriculture will be presented.
